page.title: 06Dairy farmer's day,Liskeard
page.content: At half-past six in the morning my dad gets up to milk the cows, it takes about an hour. First he fills two buckets with warm water to wash the cows' udders to prevent germs getting into the milk. After dad has wiped the udder clean he puts the milkers on. Then he switches them on , he has to pull down a lever and push a switch on the milkers anticlockwise this will start milking. After the cow has been milked the udders have a liquid which stops them from chapping. After dad has finished he goes in and has breakfast. Mum is a milk recorder and she sometimes milks the cows for dad. After breakfast dad goes and turns the hay to help it dry quicker. Then he puts the cows out in a field. In the afternoon he bales the hay and stores it in a barn.In the evening dad milks the cows again.He goes to bed at ten.
